questions.question: We swam …………………………. the river.
questions.description: Over is used to say to the other side of something high.

questions.question: Whenever I talk, she cuts me …………………………….
questions.description: To cut someone short is to interrupt them.

questions.question: I have been watching a lot of films ………………………………
They searched far and …………………………….
questions.description: Far and wide is an idiomatic expression. It means over a large area.

questions.question: She spent the ………………………………. day in bed.
questions.description: The correct patterns are: the + whole + noun and all + (the) + noun.

questions.question: I don’t think that she got your letter. You had better write ……………………………
I have ………………………….. to see my parents twice since January.
questions.description: Been is used to talk about completed visits.

questions.question: My sister always ……………………………… me at chess.
I almost never …………………………… when I play chess with my sister.
questions.description: You win a game or argument. You beat the person you are playing against.

questions.question: I finished early ……………………………… I worked fast.
questions.description: Because shows cause. Because of is a preposition.

questions.question: ……………………………….. your stupidity, we are in trouble now.
questions.description: Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun.
